page.title: 20FOOTPATHS IN SWINDERBY AREA.
page.content: {Footpaths}across the fields joining the farms and the village must have played a very important part in the lives of the residents in previous generations, but during the last few years they have been neglected or ploughed over by the farmers. The County Councils have now erected field path signs showing routes of paths and bridleways. The A46 which passes through the area is the {Roman}Foss Way between Bath and Lincoln. The Romanstone plantation near Potter Hill is named after the Roman Mile or Boundary Stone that was found there, this is now kept in Newark Millgate Museum. There is a site of a Roman Villa on Folly Lane and pottery has been found nearby. This project has been compiled by the{2nd Swinderby Guides}with the help of their parents and friends.
